item.title: Query Languages for Data
item.description: Query Languages for Data If you have a list of animal species and you want to return only the sharks in the list, a relational algebra expression would be \( \text{sharks} = \sigma_{\text{family = “Sharks”}}(\text{animals}) \). SQL queries follow the structure of relational algebra closely: SELECT * FROM animals WHERE family = 'Sharks'; … while an imperative query would be: function getSharks() { let sharks = []; for (let i = 0; i < animals.
